app.word: Events, Conditions, and Actions Definition Groups
Global Arguments and Object Conversion Mapping
Enter the response parameter key to set the value for
This will flush all entries for this log. Are you sure you want to continue?

The data key can only be lowercase alphanumerics (including underscores).
It is used to access this data from the host object. Example: $value = $object->getRulesData( 'key' );
Note: If you change this key, rules that use this data will still work.
However, any token replacements or custom code which use the changed key will break.

Automatic display will output the field data on the front end where it is appropriate ( inline with content, on member profile, etc. ). Manual will require you to use template tags in your theme to display field data. Note: template tags can still be used in automatic display mode.

Public mode will allow the field to be edited by any member with permission. Administrative mode will limit editing of the field to moderators with permission to moderate the item the data is associated with.
Enter the name of the tab that this field should appear under on editing forms
This key is already being used for another field
Your data key contains invalid characters. Only lowercase alphanumerics (including underscores) are allowed.
If you select a bulk process argument, this action will be run repeatedly until every associated record in the system has been used as the argument.
Bulk processing is processed in batches so that large runs can be handled reliably.
When enabled, this custom action can be triggered from an api endpoint. Grant access to it using your REST API settings.
Select the methods that can be used to interact with the endpoint.

You can type the names of replacement tokens (including the brackets) into text entry fields on this form and they will be replaced by their associated data when the rule is executed.
Alternative token format: Replace the brackets with tildes ( ~ ) ( Example: ~token:name~ ) for use in places where brackets are problematic (such as urls).
Once the log reaches the maximum size, old log entries will be discarded as new entries are added.
If the maximum number of entries is reached for any specific entity, older logs for that entity will be discarded as new ones are added.
Log entries older than the specified number of days will be automatically discarded.
Choose the number of logs that should show per page when this log is displayed.
If selected, this log will display even if it has no entries.
This setting controls whether the log time should be displayed in the log table.
This language will be used for the log time column title.
This language will be used for the log message column title.
The machine name can only be lowercase alphanumerics (including underscores). It will be used as a variable name in rules configurations.
Enter the classname of the object
Select if this argument must be provided.
Describe what this argument is for. (ex: Member to send the email to )
This machine name is already being used
This machine name is already being used by another parent
This machine name contains invalid characters. Only lowercase alphanumerics (including underscores) are allowed.
Independent Rule (not part of a rule set)

Immediate actions are taken before other rules on the same event are evaluated.
Actions executed at the end of the event allow actions to queue while other rules on the same event are tested.
Actions selected to execute at the end of the page load will queue until all events on the page have finished.
Actions selected to happen at a future time will be queued and executed via cron.
At the end of the event (default)
At the end of the page load
Fixed amount of time in the future
A specific date in the future

• object: An \IPS\DateTime Object
  • int: A unix timestamp
  • string: A date/time string

Optional. Only one action will remain scheduled for any given keyphrase at a time. If an action is rescheduled, any previously scheduled actions with the same keyphrase will be removed.
Note: Token replacements can be used in your keyphrase.
Standard - Perform when conditions on the rule ARE MET.
Else - Perform when conditions on the rule ARE NOT MET.
Warning: PHP is for advanced users only. Your php code needs to return a value to use as the argument. Do not include a <?php tag at the beginning of your code, or comment it out if you do.
The operation expects you to return one of the following argument types:
The following variables are available to your php code:
If the event data for this argument is empty, an alternative value can be used.
If enabled, information related to this rule will be logged in the debug console.
These actions will be taken when the conditions on the rule ARE NOT MET.

You can choose how you want the base conditions for this rule to be evaluated.
  • If you choose AND, all base conditions must be valid for actions to be executed.
  • If you choose OR, actions will be executed if any base condition is valid.

Since this condition has subconditions, you must choose how you want those subconditions to affect the state of this condition.
  • If you choose AND, this condition and all subconditions must be true for this condition to be valid.
  • If you choose OR, this condition will pass if it is valid, or if any subcondition is valid.
Using NOT will reverse the condition result so that the result is TRUE if the condition is NOT MET.

Rules has determined that this data may sometimes be empty. This argument is optional for the operation. However, you may still provide an alternative value to use in case it is not provided by the event.

Rules has determined that this data may sometimes be empty. This argument is REQUIRED for the operation to work. If you do not provide an alternative value, this operation will be skipped if the event data is missing.
This rule was designed for an event that cannot currently be triggered on your system. Configuration is disabled.
Describe what this rule is for
By default, conditions are protected from the possiblity of infinite loops by recursion protection. This option turns that protection off for edge cases where it is needed.
By default, actions are protected from the possiblity of infinite loops by recursion protection. This option turns that protection off for edge cases where it is needed.

Any groups selected here will be added to the members secondary groups, preserving any existing secondary groups they may be assigned to.
Member To Remove Secondary Groups From
Any groups selected here will be removed from the members secondary groups, preserving any other secondary groups they may be assigned to.
Member To Set Secondary Groups For
Any groups selected here will become the only secondary groups assigned to the member.
